alert.note: Alert for Central Interior; Deltana and Tanana Flats; Denali; Eastern Alaska Range; Middle Tanana Valley; Southeastern Brooks Range; Upper Koyukuk Valley; Upper Tanana Valley and the Fortymile Country; Yukon Flats and Surrounding Uplands (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 21 at 5:08PM AKST by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...Cold Wave Expected To Continue Through The Weekend... Very cold temperatures in the 20 below to 50 below range are expected to continue in valley locations across the Eastern Interior through this weekend. Windy locations such as Delta Junction and Nenana have much warmer temperatures, but the wind chills in those locations remain in the 20 below to 50 below range. Other valley locations, such as Fairbanks, may see winds develop Thursday night and Friday, which will cause temperatures to rise in those locations as well, but winds chills will remain 20 to 50 below. Due to a strong inversion, hills above 1000 ft have temperatures in the zero to 20 below range. A weather front moving across the Interior Thursday night and Friday will cause hill temperature to fall to very cold values by Friday.
